Class BigRational

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigRational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArithmeticObject<BigRational>, java.lang.Comparable<BigRational>

    public class BigRational
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<BigRational>, ArithmeticObject<BigRational>
    This class implements arbitrary precision rational numbers (i.e., fractions).
    Author:
    CJ Miller.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigRational(java.math.BigInteger numerator, java.math.BigInteger denominator)
      Constructs an arbitrary precision rational number with the given numerator and denominator.
      BigRational(java.lang.String numerator, java.lang.String denominator)
      Constructs an arbitrary precision rational number with the given numerator and denominator.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BigRational abs()
      Returns a type T object whose value is the absolute value of this ArithmeticObject.
      BigRational add(BigRational other)
      Returns a type T object whose value is (this + other), that is, the result of adding the given type T object to this ArithmeticObject.
      int compareTo(BigRational arg0) 
      BigRational divide(BigRational other)
      Returns a type T object whose value is (this / other), that is, the result of dividing this ArithmeticObject by the given type T object.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      Returns true if the given object is a BigRational that equals this BigRational.
      BigRational multiply(BigRational other)
      Returns a type T object whose value is (this * other), that is, the result of multiplying this ArithmeticObject by the given type T object.
      BigRational negate()
      Returns a type T object whose value is (- this), that is, has the same absolute value but opposite sign of this ArithmeticObject.
      BigRational subtract(BigRational other)
      Returns a type T object whose value is (this - other), that is, the result of subtracting the given type T object from this ArithmeticObject.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String that represents this BigRational, as follows: If the BigRational is a whole number, the String is just that whole number.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this BigRational, as follows: If the BigRational is a whole number, the String is just that whole number. Otherwise, the String is "numerator/denominator" with the BigRational's numerator and denominator, in lowest terms. No spaces. If the BigRational is negative, the minus sign is displayed with the numerator (not the denominator).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
